data.name: Format Hyperlinks
data.description:
### Task
Using markdown, it's possible to format links such as `https://www.codewars.com/users/leaderboard`, into something tidier like [this](https://www.codewars.com/users/leaderboard "Go to the leaderboard!"). Notice how the text _"Go to the leaderboard!"_ appears when hovering over the link.

This was achieved by using this code:

```
[this](https://www.codewars.com/users/leaderboard "Go to the leaderboard!")
```

Given the `url`, the new `name` and **optionally** the `hover_text`, return the tidied up hyperlink as a string.

### Examples
```
tidy_link("https://www.codewars.com/users/leaderboard", "this", "Go to the leaderboard!") ➞ "[this](https://www.codewars.com/users/leaderboard "Go to the leaderboard!")"

tidy_link("https://www.google.com", "Google", "Google Search") ➞ "[Google](https://www.google.com "Google Search")"

tidy_link("https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dQw4w9WgXcQ", "Click Me!") ➞ "[Click Me!](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dQw4w9WgXcQ)"
```

### Notes
- Supply **double quotes** for the hover text.
- Keep in mind that some tests will not include an argument for `hover_text`.
